title: Bold Sans, K leg curved, low A bar
content:
Anyone recognize the font used for "L'ALASKA" in the image behind the link below?

[http://www.the-mad-librarian.com/ebay/16c-03-07/DSC\_0003](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107174336/http:/www.the-mad-librarian.com/ebay/16c-03-07/DSC_0003 "http://www.the-mad-librarian.com/ebay/16c-03-07/DSC\_0003")
author: tupper

comments.content:
I presumed that this was pre-digital and searched the Jaspert 'Encyclopaedia of Type Faces'. I couldn't find a match. That pretty much uses up my resources for non-American metal type.

What is the age of the book?

- Mike Yanega
Whoa, that is a cool one; I must know, as well

The book was printed in 1945.

Mike, thanks for putting up the various font guides. I've spent many an hour browsing through them.
